neighbors.name: Michael A & Dawn A Radford Revocable Inter Vivos Trust
neighbors.claims: Michael A. Radford and Dawn A. Radford hold their Saline County land under a revocable living trust, as reflected in county property records [Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Michael-Radford/KS). No public statements or media reports were found of the Radfords taking any position on local development or clean energy projects [Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/e74744c0-255e-453b-83b9-51557137da81).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a personal, respectful conversation via a trusted community member, emphasizing listening to any of their farmland or property concerns.

neighbors.name: Randall C McGraw & Lindsay R McGraw
neighbors.claims: Randall C. McGraw and Lindsay R. McGraw jointly own a rural parcel in Saline County, Kansas, which is likely used as agricultural land [Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Randall-McGraw/KS). There is no record in local news or public minutes of the McGraws speaking for or against development or renewable energy proposals in the area [Salina Journal](https://www.salina.com/).
neighbors.influence_justification: No known civic roles; private citizens

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the McGraws informally via a neighbor or agricultural extension contact they trust, focusing on transparent information-sharing and addressing any questions about land impact.

neighbors.name: Eric M Puvogel & Amanda L Meier
neighbors.claims: Eric M. Puvogel and Amanda L. Meier are listed as landowners in Saline County, Kansas, residing in the local area where their jointly owned parcel is located [Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Eric-Puvogel/KS). They have not made any known public comments or taken a visible stance regarding development or energy projects in the community [KSAL News](https://www.ksal.com/4-1-vote-stops-power-storage-facility-project/).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public profile or leadership roles

approach_recommendations.engage: A friendly, face-to-face approach via a mutual acquaintance or local community meeting can help open dialogue and understand any concerns they might have quietly.

overview_summary: None of the three neighboring landowners have a publicly documented position on the development, so all are classified with an unknown stance. All appear to be private local landowners without formal leadership roles, meaning there are no high-influence neighbors in this group.
